title: That staff be directed to proceed as authorized in Closed Session on April 3, 2023.

That staff be directed to proceed as authorized in Closed Session on April 3, 2023. That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report CLSOCS23-005 dated April 11, 2023 of the City Solicitor as follows: That Report CLSOCS23-005 dated April 11, 2023 of the City Solicitor, Legal Considerations re Naloxone, be received for information.

That items Change to the Schedule of Meetings for the Peterborough Architectural Advisory Committee, Report CLSCLK23-010; Transfer of Funds for Community Strategic Planning from the Joint Housing Reserve, Report CSSS23- 016; By-law to Name Ontario Works Administrator, Report CSSS23-014; and Citizen Appointments to Various Committees, Report CLSCLK23-011 be approved on Consent.

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSPL23-007, dated April 11, 2023 of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That the presentation of the Central Area Urban Design Guidelines by The Planning Partnership Ltd. be received; b) That changes required to align with the new official plan, as amended and approved by the Province of Ontario as of Tuesday April 11th, 2023 be noted in the Central Area Urban Design guidelines prior to public engagement and adoption; and,

That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report IPSPL23-007, dated April 11, 2023 of the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services as follows: a) That the presentation of the Central Area Urban Design Guidelines by The Planning Partnership Ltd. be received; b) That changes required to align with the new official plan, as amended and approved by the Province of Ontario as of Tuesday April 11th, 2023 be noted in the Central Area Urban Design guidelines prior to public engagement and adoption; and, c) That the illustration on the bottom of page 89 be deleted pending a forthcoming report.

studies for these roadways in accordance with City’s Traffic Calming Policy; f) That notice be given to close Bethune Street between Antrim Street and Parkhill Road West as shown on Appendix B in accordance with the City’s Notice to Public Policy; and g) That the Commissioner of Infrastructure and Planning Services be delegated the authority enact and/or amend a by-law to give effect the following actions: i. Closure of Bethune Street between Antrim Street and Parkhill Road West; ii. Restrict turning movements at the intersection of Parkhill Road West and Aylmer Street; and iii. Remove Stop Sign on Bethune Street at Parkhill Road West.

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report COU23-003 dated April 11, 2023 as follows: a) That City Council approve the Strategic Plan attached to Report COU23-003 as Appendix A. b) That the words, “the arts” be included in the Community and Wellbeing section of Appendix A

That Council approve the recommendation outlined in Report COU23-003 dated April 11, 2023 as follows: a) That City Council approve the Strategic Plan attached to Report COU23-003 as Appendix A. b) That the words, “the arts” be included in the Community and Wellbeing section of Appendix A That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSHR23-005 dated April 11, 2023, of the Corporate and Legislative Services Commissioner as follows: a) That information about Naloxone in City Facilities in Report CLSHR23-005, dated April 11, 2023, of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, be received for information. b) That staff be directed to develop materials to educate employees about the signs of overdose, and what to do if staff suspect an overdose.
2023, of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, be received for information.

2023, of the Commissioner of Corporate and Legislative Services, be received for information. That Council approve the recommendations outlined in Report CLSCLK23-009, dated April 11, 2023 of the City Clerk as follows: a) That the City Clerk be delegated the authority to approve requests for temporary outdoor physical extensions (temporary patios) of liquor licensed premises under Part X of Ontario Regulation 746/21, Physical Extensions of Licensed Premises. b) That a fee of $300 be established for the processing of temporary patio extension applications and that a by-law be approved to amend Form 6 of User Fee By-law 23-028 to include the fee.
That this meeting adjourn at 8:49 p.m.
